links.*: Of Tuor and his Coming to Gondolin

wikitext.*:
'''Taras-ness''' was the headland of [[Mount Taras]], on the shores of the land of [[Nevrast]], where [[Turgon]] had his original citadel of [[Vinyamar]].<ref>{{UT|Tuor}}</ref>

In place names, the suffix -ness comes from the Old English ''næss'' (or ''ness'') and means "cape", "promontory", or "land jutting out into the sea"<ref>“Ness.” Merriam-Webster.com Dictionary, Merriam-Webster, https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/ness. Accessed 19 Nov. 2025.</ref>.
